trans-unit.source: Represents the base class for <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Data.PriorityBindingExpression"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref>.
For information about bindings and binding expressions, see "Binding and BindingExpression" in [Data Binding Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview.md).
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingGroup"></xref> that this binding expression belongs to.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingGroup"></xref> that this binding expression belongs to.
This property returns `null` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> is not part of a <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingGroup"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the parent binding has a failed validation rule.
This property is identical to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase.HasValidationError%2A> property.
`true` if the parent binding has a failed validation rule; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the parent binding has a failed validation rule.
This property is identical to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase.HasValidationError%2A> property.
`true` if the parent binding has a failed validation rule; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the target of the binding has a value that has not been written to the source.

This property applies only if <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.Mode%2A> property of the parent <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingMode.TwoWay> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingMode.OneWayToSource>.
`true` if the target has a value that has not been written to the source; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingBase"></xref> object from which this <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> object is created.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingBase"></xref> object from which this <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> object is created.
Gets the status of the binding expression.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingStatus"></xref> value that describes the status of the binding expression.
Gets the element that is the binding target object of this binding expression.
The element that is the binding target object of this binding expression.
Gets the binding target property of this binding expression.
The binding target property of this binding expression.

Sends the current binding target value to the binding source in <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingMode.TwoWay"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingMode.OneWayToSource"></xref> bindings.
There is no default implementation on the base class.
Forces a data transfer from the binding source to the binding target.
There is no default implementation on the base class.

Runs any <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule"></xref> objects on the associated <xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding"></xref> that have the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationRule.ValidationStep"></xref> property set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationStep.RawProposedValue"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationStep.ConvertedProposedValue"></xref>.
This method does not update the source.
The <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase.ValidateWithoutUpdate%2A> method enables you to run validation rules on a binding without updating the source of the binding.
This is useful when you want to validate user input and update the source at different times in an application.
For example, suppose you have a form to update a data source that contains a submit button.
You want to provide feedback to the user if an invalid value is entered before the user attempts to submit the form.

You can check the validity of a field by setting the binding's <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.UpdateSourceTrigger%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Data.UpdateSourceTrigger.Explicit> and calling <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase.ValidateWithoutUpdate%2A> when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox> loses focus.
`true` if the validation rules succeed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationError"></xref> that caused this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> to be invalid.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationError"></xref> that caused this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> to be invalid.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationError"></xref> objects that caused this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> to be invalid.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationError"></xref> objects that caused this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> to be invalid.
The value is `null` if there are no errors.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The type of the <xref href="System.Windows.WeakEventManager"></xref> calling this method.
This only recognizes manager objects of type <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.CollectionChangedEventManager"></xref>.
Object that originated the event.
Event data.
`true` if the listener handled the event; otherwise, `false`.
